field.label: Multiple Stock Locations
field.comment: Please enable to manage the product stock per warehouse. If disabled, the product stock is managed natively
field.tooltip:
Physical stock: Current Stock in the warehouse
Quantity to ship: Stock quantity booked for ordered products to be dispatched
Available Quantity: Stock Quantity in the warehouse available for sale
Physical Stock = Available Quantity + Quantity to ship

field.label: Calculate the shipping cost based on warehouse location
field.comment: If the option is enabled, the address of a warehouse is considered as a pick-up address for the shipping service provider. Shipping rate to be calculated accordingly.
field.tooltip:
1. If the option is enabled, the address of a warehouse is considered as a pick-up address for the shipping service provider. Shipping rate to be calculated accordingly.
2. If the option is disabled or when ordered product is not assigned to a warehouse, the store address is considered as a pick-up address for the shipping service provider. The shipping rate is to be calculated accordingly.
3. When ordered products are assigned to multiple warehouses, multiple orders may be created depending on the appropriate setting. Otherwise, one order is created and the shipping rates are calculated separately for each warehouse and summarized

field.label: Choose Warehouse based on
field.comment: Use the drag & drop option to reorder criteria according which a warehouse(s) for products assigned to multiple storages will be determined
field.tooltip:
Customer Group: The warehouse assigned to the Customer Group is selected.
Nearest warehouse: The warehouse nearest to customer address (uses the Google API) is selected.
Store view: The warehouse assigned to the store view the order placed from is selected.
Warehouse priority: The warehouse with the highest priority (1 is the highest) is selected.
How it works:
  1.The extension starts searching for a warehouse by the first criteria. It moves to the next criteria if no warehouse matches the first one.
  2.If more than one warehouse is found, the next criteria will be used. And so on until a single warehouse is determined.
  3.If in the selected warehouse the product quantity is not enough for the order, the items from the next warehouse will be taken.
  4.If more than one warehouse is found after all searches, the warehouse with the highest stock level will be used.
  5.In case all search criteria are inactive, the warehouse with the highest stock level will be used.
  6.If the ordered item is not assigned to any warehouse, the Total (default) Stock will be chosen.

field.comment: If the option is enabled, the returned items will affect the general product quantity and will be automatically added to the appropriate warehouse

field.label: Low stock Quantity
field.comment: Please specify the quantity value for the 'Low Stock'. All products with the stock level less or equal to the specified value will be considered as 'Low stock'

field.label: Backorders configuration
field.comment: This option defines the value to use for the "Use Config Settings" field. By default each product utilizes the "Use Config Settings" value for backorders. You can check and modify this options here: Products > Product Edit > Warehouses > Backorders Column.
field.tooltip:
Product Value — choose this option to use backorders value from the product's Advanced Inventory for "Use Config Settings". You can modify it here: Products > Product Edit > Advanced Inventory > "Backorders" DropDown.
Warehouse Value — using this option the global backorder variable will be used for each particular warehouse. You can configure it here: Products > Warehouses > Edit Warehouse > "Backorders" DropDown.

Regardless of the selected value you can change the backorders settings for each particular product by setting the desired parameter instead of "Use Config Settings". You can select from: No Backorders; Allow Qty Below 0; Allow Qty Below 0 and Notify Customers.

field.label: Backorders Algorithm for ordering products
field.comment: The option allows you to define the backorders algorithm for ordered products
field.tooltip:
Backorders first — choose this option to use backorders and avoid selling products that are available in other warehouses.
Availability first — choose this option to use backorders only when the product is not available in all warehouses.
